intro: Cephalophora foliosa, commonly known as the leafy cephalophora, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, hairy leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in dense clusters. The plant is native to southern Africa and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. The species is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
